reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After dozens of different red lipsticks that have come and gone through my life, I finally found my perfect shade and texture. I almost never write reviews but this lipstick warranted one. The texture is hit or miss with some people, but I like the powdery finish this dries down to as I've always had a preference for drier, matte textures. I find it much more comfortable than something like MAC's Ruby Woo, which is a great red velvet, but can feel pretty dry and cast-like. These lip suedes aren't quite transfer proof and I do need to reapply the inner parts of my lip after eating, but it doesn't feel at all gloopy or messy to me like most satin texture lipsticks do. I prefer applying this with a lip brush (in fact I think these lipsticks were made for lip brushes, as I always get the best application with them). I also have the shades Je Reve, which is a perfect my lips but better shade on me, and Pique, which pulls very taupe-y brown on me and goes perfectly with a smokey eye. Ma Biche is the one red lipstick I have now that would make me comfortable getting rid of all my other red lipsticks, it's definitely a keeper.

reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm a very fair skinned, very cool toned person. I‚Äôm a ‚Äúdeep winter‚Äù in the seasonal colors. This means I‚Äôm able to wear dark colors despite being so fair. I tell you all this because I feel like it‚Äôs a slightly niche category. None of the shades in this line were cool toned enough for me except for Lou Lou and Ma Biche. Lou Lou is a deeeep red that‚Äôs nearly purple. It‚Äôs even, stays on, leaves a faint stain, doesn‚Äôt smear easily, and feels almost like wearing nothing. The slight feeling of having it on is pleasant though. It‚Äôs matte, but it‚Äôs very neutral as far as being drying or moisturizing. I really love it. It‚Äôs become my favorite dramatic lip look. In the picture I‚Äôm posting my lips are very chapped, but even so, I‚Äôm able to wear this without it making my chapped lips look worse. I highly recommend this formula, though I‚Äôd love to see some more cool toned shades introduced.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I received the Westman Atelier Lip Suede Hydrating Matte Lipstick with Hyaluronic Acid complimentary in exchange for my honest opinion. The first thing I noticed about this lipstick was the lovely high end tube and how heavy it is. It could definitely add weight to a lady's handbag. Upon removing the lid from the luxe tube, I quickly discovered that it is magnetic! How cool is that! No loosing the top in your handbag for sure! As an added touch, the lipstick bullet has embossed hearts. After using the product a few times, I noted that there is a tiny mirror in the lid. Oh my gosh! How clever! Now on to the product itself, the manufacturer claims that this matt lipstick has hyaluronic acid and peptides to plump lips and soften lines. After several applications, I didn't really notice any of that. There may be a slight plumping but nothing really noticeable. When applying, the first thing you notice is the hydrating feel of the lipstick as it glides over the lips. I didn't notice any taste or scent to the product. When eating, it does come off and regular application is necessary just as you would with any other lipstick. With a high end product, I would have expected this lipstick to be longer lasting. All in all, I would recommend this lipstick to others especially the color, Je Reve. It is a neutral shade and so pretty!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Olive skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_title: Ok but leaves much to be desired
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love matte lipsticks, own quite a few of them, and was so excited when Gucci announced this launch on her IG. Although I was underwhelmed when I saw the shade range online, I kept hope and ordered the lipstick in Piqu√© and Je R√™ve. And while the formula is lovely and not at all drying, both shades just looked so unininspired and generic when I put them on. The performance also left much to be desired‚Äîno longevity and no blurring effect, which I find makes a big difference in mattes. There are so many great lipsticks on the market these days‚Äîfrom drugstore to indie brands to Herm√®s‚Äîthat I'm really looking for innovation (both in terms of formula and shades) in a new launch, especially at this price point. For example Lisa Eldrige has done an extraordinary job developing both unique and universally flattering shades in her True Velvet Lip Color (her matte range), and the longevity is really impressive. Similarly, VIOLETTE_FR's Bisou Balm, while having a small/ basic shade range, has stunning blurring/ plumping abilities and requires minimal lip prep. I really wanted to like this but it's over-priced for what it is.

reviews.review_title: Everything that lipstick dreams are made of!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Starting with the packaging, it comes in a beautiful, weighted tube that has a magnetic closure for the top. I love that attention to detail because I have ruined many nice purses due to a lipstick opening in my bag and getting all over the lining, and no one needs that kind of negativity in their life. Now, onto the good stuff... the formulation of this lipstick feels like butter going on your lips. It's so smooth and creamy, and leaves your lips with a moisturized, pillowy look to them. The color payoff is amazing, it only requires one swipe across each lip to get full color coverage. Generally, I am a matte lip kind of girl because I love the all day staying power that a lot of matte lip formulas provide, but even with this being a suede finish lipstick, it has some serious staying power as far as the color is concerned. I can wear this for a full 8 hours with no touch ups, and still have a beautiful color on my lips. Even after wiping it off with a tissue, my lips were left moisturized with a beautiful blush color that stayed behind. As far as price is concerned, it's on the pricier side and is what I would consider to be a luxury makeup purchase. Even with a steep price tag, some things can still fail to live up to expectations, but I cannot say this is the case for this lipstick because the quality is amazing and all the expectations you look to find in a luxury product are there! If I find myself in a position to be able to treat myself and purchase more colors I most definitely will, because this has become my new favorite and I don't want it to ever run out!

reviews.review_text: Westman Atelier's Lip Suede Matte Lipstick is a luxurious, high-performance lipstick that delivers rich, velvety color with a soft, matte finish. The formula is enriched with a blend of nourishing ingredients like peptides, Vitamin C, and E and Hydro-Suede Technology -a volumizing, moisture-locking system that delivers matte pigment, and help to keep lips hydrated and comfortable throughout wear. It is infused with hyaluronic acid and peptides to plump the lips and soften lines.  I found the texture to be smooth and creamy, gliding effortlessly onto the lips without tugging or dragging. The pigmentation is excellent, providing full coverage in just one swipe. I also appreciate the sleek, chic packaging, and the mirrored, magnetic cap, which is not only beautiful but also eco-friendly, as it is refillable.  One thing to note is that while the lipstick is long-wearing, it may require touch-ups after eating or drinking. Overall, I highly recommend Westman Atelier's Lip Suede Matte Lipstick for anyone looking for a high-quality, matte lipstick that feels comfortable and looks stunning.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My first impression was just how luxe the packaging was. Sleek, minimalistic, and falls in line with the rest of their products. Inside the cap, the brand name is etched and there is a tiny little mirror that is just *perfect* to check your lipstick. It has some heft to it though. Great for the vanity, but adds to the weight of your bag. I imagine carrying two or three full-size Westman Atelier products in your handbag will add quite a bit of weight. It is a refillable case. And the refill aspect is really quite genius.. You just pull it straight out. It seems to be held in by a magnet, and it very easily pulls straight out, but the magnet keeps it firmly in place, and it will not fall out on its own. Now, the formula‚ÄîThis is where I wasn‚Äôt very impressed. I found it too creamy and moisturizing to be a matte. It was very pigmented, and it did go on smoothly. Pleasant light scent of vanilla marshmallow. I did get a slight bit of feathering with or without a lip liner, and I never felt like it really set the way a matte lipstick does. It very quickly wore off from normal, sipping on a drink; And I can only assume it wouldn‚Äôt make it through eating.  I honestly found the formula to be much like the Milani mattes. I am not sure whether that should be considered a dig this brand, or a complement to my money. But the way I see it I can get four or five of their lipsticks. For the price of one of these. I haven‚Äôt priced refills though. But I likely would not purchase anything to refill this with, because I just didn‚Äôt think that the formula and its performance was worth the high price point. I‚Äôm in love with the case & wanted to love the lipstick, but it was just okay.

First off, I really like the color - it‚Äôs got this perfect peachy pink nude going on that makes my lips pop, but in a low-key sort of way. When it comes to pigment, Westman Atelier is not messing around. One swipe across your lips and you are *good* to go!  But what's really interesting here, is how it feels. You know how some matte lipsticks make your lips feel dry? This one feels like... well, nothing.   And the packaging? Oh, she‚Äôs fancy! It's something you'd want to show off every time you take it out of your bag. Kind of like a Chanel lipstick.  If we're keeping things 100% here, it doesn't exactly last forever on your lips. It‚Äôs so nice to take out reapplying isn‚Äôt a big deal.    I would recommend this to someone who likes luxury products and is looking for a nice neutral colored comfortable matte lipstick

reviews.review_text: I recently tried the Westman Atelier Lip Suede Matte lipstick in the shade Je Reve, and I must say, I'm impressed. Instead, it leaves them feeling hydrated and comfortable throughout the day.  The packaging is also sleek and elegant, making it a luxurious addition to my makeup collection. While it's definitely on the pricier side, I believe the quality justifies the cost. Overall, I highly recommend the Westman Atelier Lip Suede Matte lipstick in Je Reve to anyone looking for a high-quality, long-lasting matte lipstick with a beautiful shade range.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I decided not to take price into consideration for my review because let‚Äôs face it - you most likely don‚Äôt care about the price too much if you‚Äôre going for products from Westman Atelier. Also, I‚Äôm no stranger to luxury lipsticks, I already have plenty from Charlotte Tilbury, Gucci, Tom Ford, YSL and the like, so it‚Äôs right up my alley. However, this is my first ever product from WA and I didn‚Äôt pay for it, so it is easier not to worry about the price. Well, I absolutely love it! It‚Äôs very creamy for a matte, with good pigmentation. I have dry lips so I still prefer to apply clear balm first, then pat the excess off with a tissue and follow with lipstick. This way it looks nicely matte without drying out my lips, the comfort matte look and feel. The shade Je Reve is more pink than I expected and I love it for spring. On first glance I was afraid it looked too similar to the latest lipstick I had purchased (Maison from the new Merit matte lippies,) but they look different enough (see photo.) It you‚Äôre wondering about the formula differences, WA is more pigmented, Merit has more of a sheer feel (without actually being sheer,) but both are comfortably creamy. WA smells yummy, similar to Charlotte Tilbury‚Äôs lipsticks.  Now the case - it‚Äôs lovely, weighted, magnetic, definitely a statement piece, BUT I would say it‚Äôs best suited for one‚Äôs vanity. If I could, I would take off half a star for the size - it‚Äôs just too bulky to easily carry it with you. In my photos you can see it next to a Saie blush, it‚Äôs even slightly wider in diameter and heavier. I normally carry a smallish satchel with me and it‚Äôs just too much for it. I wish they would make it more compact. But the hearts are super cute and I feel super fancy applying it at home before I leave.

It feels like you're not wearing anything at all and my lips are so much softer and overall look better after I've worn it. The packaging as well is absolutely gorgeous. Definitely a good lipstick to have sitting on your vanity but it's just absolutely perfect for people who love a variety of lip choices or someone looking for a soft, casual every day lipstick. Highly recommend
